posts._title: Luitz-Morat – La Cité foudroyée AKA The City Destroyed (1924)
posts.title: La Cité foudroyée
posts.excerpt: A crazed scientist planning to rule the world decides to destroy the city of Paris with his lightning/ray gun.

posts.title: That Brennan Girl
posts.excerpt: On Mother’s Day, 1946, in San Francisco, Ziggy Brennan thinks back on the events which have brought her to this day. Quote:Raised as a grifter by her single mother, a San Francisco girl (Mona Freeman, in the role that should have made her a star) learns to adjust her priorities when she is left a …

posts.title: Porto
posts.excerpt: Quote:Gabe Klinger’s Porto deals with the post-one-night-stand fallout between an American drifter working abroad, Jake (Anton Yelchin), and a forlorn French woman, Mati (Lucie Lucas). Less a city symphony than a muted impressionist painting of urban drifting, the film takes place within the shadowy side streets, modest corner bars, and nondescript 24-hour diners of the …

posts._title: Jean-Daniel Pollet – L’amour c’est gai, l’amour c’est triste aka Love Is Gay, Love Is Sad (1971)
posts.title: L’amour c’est gai, l’amour c’est triste
posts.excerpt: Quote:Leon is a tailor and he believes men are coming to see his trollop sister Marie to have their palms read. Then Arlette, a young provincial girl saved from suicide by Marie, comes to live in the apartment…
posts.titleEnglish: Love Is Gay, Love Is Sad

posts.title: Tom of Finland
posts.excerpt: Quote:Touko Laaksonen, a decorated officer, returns home after a harrowing and heroic experience serving his country in World War II, but life in Finland during peacetime proves equally distressing. He finds peace-time Helsinki rampant with persecution of the homosexual men around him, even being pressured to marry women and have children. Touko finds refuge in …

posts.title: O Dreamland
posts.excerpt: Unsparing candid-camera work and astute juxtaposition of natural sound provide a scathing, angry and wordless comment on modern popular culture as seen at a British amusement park. No attempt is made to poke fun at the people shown; they are portrayed as victims — Orwell’s 1984 “proles”. A visual and aural barrage of cheap pleasures …

posts._title: Fritz Lang – Die 1000 Augen des Dr. Mabuse AKA The 1,000 Eyes of Dr. Mabuse (1960) (HD)
posts.title: Die 1000 Augen des Dr Mabuse
posts.excerpt: Quote:In 1960s Germany, criminal mastermind Dr. Mabuse uses hypnotized victims and the surveillance equipment of a Nazi-era bugged hotel to steal nuclear technology from a visiting American industrialist.

posts._title: Roy Andersson – Om det oändliga AKA About Endlessness (2019)
posts.title: Om det oändliga
posts.excerpt: With ABOUT ENDLESSNESS, Roy Andersson adds to his cinematic oeuvre with a reflection on human life in all its beauty and cruelty, its splendour and banality.

posts._title: Ilya Khrzhanovskiy & Ilya Permyakov – DAU. Degeneratsiya AKA DAU. Degeneration (2020)
posts.title: DAU Degeneratsiya
posts.excerpt: The institute that this film is about existed twice. Once as the top-secret Institute for Physical Problems as part of the Soviet Academy of Sciences, which was in operation from 1938 to 1968, and a second time as the largest film set in Europe, which was destroyed at the end of the project. The DAU …

posts._title: Tom Brook – Talking Movies: Pandemic Special (2020)
posts.title: Talking Movies: Pandemic Special
posts.excerpt: This is a snapshot of the global state of the movie industry with a special feature on fims about pandemics and a look at what’s available to stream online “beyond the mainstream”.
